result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert R Crumble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served. (Straight Time) If revoked: Court ordered NO Huber release privileges.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period of probation.  Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
*Obtain and maintain employment, school, or a combination of both.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

timeConds.notes: *Successfully complete an additional (25) hours of community service.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert R Crumble in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year: If revoked: Court ordered NO huber release privileges.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

     *   No firearms; dangerous weapons.
     *   Successfully complete an additional (25) hours of community
          service. 
     *   Obtain and maintain employment, school, or.
          combination of both.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period
          of probation.  
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credi; received and filed.
-From Milwaukee Christian Center on behalf of the defendant; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Robert R Crumble in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Court ordered defendant to submit a DNA sample immediately after today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert R Crumble in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hezekiah C. (Co-Defendant).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert R Crumble in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-7-2015 at 1:30pm
